sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The maiden's tragedy: or, A brief account of a young damsel near Wolverhampton, who cut her throat in despair, because she could not have the man she lov'd. To the tune of Russel's farewell. Licensed according to order.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for J. Deacon, at the angel in Gilt-Spur-street, without Newgate, [London] : [between 1688-1695]
Verse - "Near Wolverhampton liv'd a maid,". Place and date of publication suggested by Wing. Imperfect: mounted and tightly bound with some loss of text. Printed on verso: Then faction comes with his confused breath ... Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
